meanings.definition: A powdery substance made by calcining lime and clay, used in construction.
meanings.sent1: The cement was mixed with water to build a sturdy wall.
meanings.sent2: The workers used cement to hold the bricks together in the new house.
meanings.sent3: The cement spilled on the ground, creating a messy situation.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like cement, strong and unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The cement mixed with sand formed a solid foundation for the building.

meanings.definition: A substance used for sticking things together.
meanings.sent1: She used cement to glue the broken pieces of the vase back together.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter applied cement to join the pieces of wood securely.
meanings.sent3: The cement held the paper firmly in place on the wall.
meanings.sent4: Their shared love for music acted as a cement in their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The cement bonded the two materials, creating a strong bond.

meanings.definition: To make something hard and strong by mixing it with cement.
meanings.sent1: They decided to cement the bricks together to build a durable structure.
meanings.sent2: The mason will cement the tiles onto the floor to make it sturdy.
meanings.sent3: He tried to cement his position in the company by working hard.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was cemented through shared experiences and trust.
meanings.sent5: The bond between them was cemented by their mutual respect and understanding.
